required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research on Hidden Blood Loss in Open Radical Hysterectomy and Pelvic Lymphadenectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Research on Hidden Blood Loss in Open Radical Hysterectomy and Pelvic Lymphadenectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this cross-sectional study is to evaluate the hidden blood loss in patients who underwent open radical hysterectomy and identity its risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock: The electronic medical data of 100 patients who undergo open radial hysterectomy in the following year to treat cervical cancer will be analyzed retrospectively in this study. The amount of hidden blood loss will be calculated according to Gross's formula. And multiple linear regression analysis will be employed to identify its risk factors.

primary_outcome.measure: the volume of hidden blood loss (mL)
primary_outcome.description: the volume of invisible blood loss occurring in patients who undergo open radical hysterectomy applying Gross's formula

secondary_outcome.measure: the risk factors of hidden blood loss
secondary_outcome.description: Performing multiple linear regression analysis with SPSS 17.0, we plan to identify the factors which may increase the volume of hidden blood loss from possible factors like hypertension, diebetes, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: the volume of total blood loss (mL)
secondary_outcome.description: the vomule of patients' blood loss through the whole perioperative time according to the method of Nadler

secondary_outcome.measure: the volume of visible blood loss (mL)
secondary_outcome.description: the visible blood loss including the blood in the suction bottle and in weighed compresses during the operation and the drainage volume after the operation

arm_group.description: The patients who would undergo "open radical hysterectomy" procedure.

study_pop.textblock: The planned sample size was based on data from a previous study, in which the standard deviation was 5. We assumed an one-tailed Î± error of 0.05 and a sampling error of 1.0. we propose to enroll 105 participants and allow for a dropout rate of 10% for an effective sample size of 100.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
